conclusion: Determine the refractive index of the glass column using Snell's law and properties of light path.
Identify the radius of the glass column and distances from P to AC and MC.
Determine coordinates of P using circle properties and given distance, resulting in coordinates (R/2, sqrt(3)R/2).
Determine coordinates of M using given distance MC and BC interface, resulting in coordinates (R, 2sqrt(3)R/3).
Calculate angle of incidence at P as 30 degrees using normal and light ray angle.
Calculate angle of refraction at M as 60 degrees using tangent inverse and coordinates.
Use Snell's law to calculate refractive index as 1/sqrt(3).
Re-evaluate angle of refraction using correct approach, resulting in angle of 45 degrees.
Use Snell's law with corrected angle to calculate refractive index as sqrt(2).
Determine final refractive index of glass column as sqrt(3).
